ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: Assignment, Cotenancy and Common Facilities Agreement

record_data.record_plain_text: 48 Wildorado Wind, LLC and Golden Spread Panhandle Wind Ranch, LLC FERC FPA Electric Tariff Assignment, Cotenancy and Common Facilities Agreement Proposed Effective Date 2010-10-14 FERC Rate Schedule No. 1 Option Code A 1 ASSIGNMENT, COTENANCY, AND COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENT by and between WILDORADO WIND, LLC, a Texas limited liability company, AND GOLDEN SPREAD PANHANDLE WIND RANCH, LLC, a Texas limited liability company Effective September 30, 2010 Table of Contents Page Article I DEFINITIONS 6 1.1 Certain Definitions. 6 Article II COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENTS 12 2.1 Cotenants Intent 12 2.2 Development and Construction of Wildorado II Project 13 2.3 Initial Sharing Ratio 14 2.4 Priority of Use 14 2.5 Technical Committee 15 2.6 Rights to Common Facilities 16 2.7 Shared Expenses and Line Losses 17 2.8 Interconnection Agreement 18 2.9 Maximum Projects to Interconnect 18 2.10 Indemnity 19 2.11 Environmental Compliance 20 2.12 No Waste or Nuisance; Maintenance; No Interference 20 2.13 Liens; Sales 20 2.14 Taxes 21 2.15 Operation and Management 21 2.16 Manager 21 2.17 Specific Authority of Manager 23 2.18 Indemnification of Manager 24 2.19 Manager Limitation of Liability 24 2.20 Removal of Manager 24 2.21 Step-in Rights 24 2.22 Events of Default; Default 25 2.23 Remedies 25 2.24 Equitable Relief 26 2.25 Arbitration 26 2.26 Force Majeure 26 Table of Contents (continued) Page 2.27 Effect of Force Majeure 26 2.28 Confidentiality of Cotenant Information 27 2.29 Rights to Electricity 27 2.30 Scheduling 27 2.31 Cotenants Not an Electric Utility 27 2.32 FERC or Other Governmental Jurisdiction 28 2.33 Insurance Requirements of Wildorado II 28 2.34 Letter of Credit for Interconnection Construction Costs..30 Article III MANAGEMENT 31 3.1 Manager 31 3.2 Intentionally Deleted 31 3.3 Delegation of Authority 31 3.4 Indemnity of the Manager and Other Agents 31 3.5 Budget 31 3.6 Prudent Management 32 3.7 Voting or Approval Rights 32 Article IV TRANSFERABILITY 32 4.1 General Restriction 32 4.2 FERC Approval 33 4.3 Lender Protections 33 Article V REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 34 5.1 Representations and Warranties of Cotenants and Manager 34 Article VI TERM AND TERMINATION 35 6.1 Term and Termination 35 6.2 Surrender and Assignment of Undivided Interest 35 6.3 Abandonment or Decommissioning of a Project 35 6.4 Distribution on Termination of this Agreement 36 Article VII MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS 37 7.1 Notices 37 7.2 Choice of Law 37 7.3 Covenants Running with the Land 38 7.4 No Partnership; Tenant-in-Common Status 38 7.5 Entity Cotenant 38 7.6 Representative Capacity 38 7.7 Titles 39 7.8 Survival of Agreement 39 7.9 Entire Agreement 39 7.10 Interpretation 39 7.11 Waiver 39 7.12 No Third Party Beneficiaries 39 7.13 Counterparts; Facsimile Signatures 40 7.14 Amendments 40 7.15 Further Assurances 40 7.16 Memorandum 40 7.17 Side Letters 40 ASSIGNMENT, COTENANCY, AND COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS ASSIGNMENT, COTENANCY, AND COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this Agreement) is made and entered into as of September 30, 2010, by and between WILDORADO WIND, LLC, a Texas limited liability company (Wildorado I) and WILDORADO WIND TWO, LLC, a Texas limited liability company (Wildorado II). Each of Wildorado I and Wildorado II are referred to herein individually as a Cotenant and collectively as the Cotenants; each also as a Party, and collectively as the Parties). RECITALS A. Each Cotenant has developed, or is in the process of developing, Projects. Pursuant to (i) those certain agreements set forth on Exhibit A hereto and (ii) those certain assignment and assumption or other agreements which may, in the future, be entered into by and between Wildorado I and Wildorado II, each Cotenant has an undivided ownership share legal interest, as tenants-in-common, in certain assets, including certain facilities, permits, agreements and other developmental assets, which assets shall be used by the Cotenants. In furtherance thereof, the Cotenants wish to set forth certain of their rights and responsibilities in respect of the development and operation of the Common Facilities necessary to the Projects. B. Pursuant to that certain Assignment and Assumption Agreement (Interconnection Agreement) dated as of September 30, 2010 (the Interconnection Assignment Agreement), by and between Wildorado I and Wildorado Interconnect, LLC, a Texas limited liability company (Wildorado Interconnect), Wildorado I transferred the Interconnection Agreement to Wildorado Interconnect, which entity is jointly owned and operated by the Cotenants. The Cotenants intend that (i) Wildorado Interconnect shall hold the Interconnection Agreement for the Cotenants in connection with the Projects and (ii) notwithstanding the transfer to Wildorado Interconnect, both Cotenants shall be bound by, and comply with, the terms of the Interconnection Agreement. C. The Cotenants intend to utilize the Common Facilities in connection with their respective wind powered electric generation projects. Each Cotenant is (i) the owner, as a tenant-in-common, of certain easement and access rights across the lands necessary for the Common Facilities, (ii) required, as necessary, to grant easements and other access rights across its Project Lands which are necessary for the Common Facilities and any meters servicing the Projects owned by any Cotenant, and (iii) required to bear its Sharing Ratio in the Shared Expenses. D. To govern their respective rights and obligations with respect to the Common Facilities and the Shared Expenses, the Parties are entering into this Agreement, which shall be the Cotenants expression of their intention to establish and impose mutually beneficial limitations, restrictions, covenants and conditions to provide for the proper and orderly ownership, operation and management of their respective wind powered electric generation projects and of the Common Facilities. NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing and of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties, and each of them, hereby agree as follows: DEFINITIONS Certain Definitions. Capitalized words and phrases used herein shall have the following meanings, or the meanings given in the Sections of this Agreement in which they are defined, unless the text expressly or by necessary implication requires otherwise. AAA has the meaning set forth in Section 2.25. Agreement has the meaning given in the preamble to this Agreement. Budget has the meaning given in Section 3.5. Bushorado means Bushorado Wind, LLC, a Texas limited liability company. Bushorado Letter Agreement means that certain Letter Agreement dated as of the date hereof, by and among Wildorado I, Wildorado II and Bushorado. Bushorado Project means, collectively, the wind power generation facilities to be developed by Bushorado (or Bushorados successors, assigns or affiliates) generally to the east of the Wildorado II Project with an aggregate Maximum Nameplate Capacity of all such facilities not to exceed 80.5 MW. Common Facilities means, collectively, the Common Physical Facilities, the Shared Project Agreements, the Shared Licenses and Permits, and the Shared Real Property Documents, an undivided ownership share legal interest in which is jointly owned, as tenants-in-common, by the Cotenants. Common Facilities Percentage Interest means, with respect to each Cotenant, the percentage of the Design Capacity of the Common Physical Facilities that each Cotenant has a right to use. As currently contemplated, the (i) Common Facilities Percentage Interest of Wildorado I shall be determined based on the ratio equal to (A) 161 MW (the Wildorado I Share) over (B) the Design Capacity (i.e., Wildorado I Share/Design Capacity), and (ii) the Common Facilities Percentage Interest of Wildorado II shall be determined based on the ratio equal to (A) 79 MW, subject to adjustment as provided in this Agreement (the Wildorado II Share) over (B) the Design Capacity (i.e., Wildorado II Share/Design Capacity). Common On Call and Maintenance Agreement means any On Call and Maintenance Agreement entered into by and between the Cotenants and Dixie Electric Odessa, Texas, or such other entity as may be designated by the Cotenants. Common Physical Facilities means the transmission line, the Shared Switching Station, and all other interconnection and transmission facilities in which an undivided ownership share legal interest is jointly owned, as tenants-in-common, by the Cotenants from time to time, the use of which is contemplated to be shared by the Wildorado I Project and the Wildorado II Project in accordance with this Agreement. Cotenant has the meaning given in the preamble to this Agreement. Default Rate means, as of any date of calculation, the prime rate of interest quoted by Citibank, N.A. on the date nearest to such date of calculation, plus two percent (2%) per annum. Delivery Date has the meaning given in Section 3.5. Demolition Expenses has the meaning given in Section 6.3. Design Capacity means the design capacity of the Common Physical Facilities, which is currently contemplated to be 240 MW, but which may be increased or decreased from time to time. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, the Parties acknowledge and agree that if, for any reason, the Design Capacity is determined to be less than 240 MW, the first 161 MW of capacity in the Common Facilities shall be allocated to Wildorado I, and the capacity of Wildorado II shall be decreased accordingly. Effective Date means the date first written above. Environmental Laws means, collectively, any and all Laws pertaining to pollution or protection of health, safety or environment, including Laws (both statutory and common law) relating to actual or threatened emissions, discharges, or releases of pollutants, raw materials, products, contaminants, or hazardous or toxic materials or wastes into ambient air, surface water, groundwater, or land, or otherwise relating to the manufacture, processing, distribution, use, treatment, storage, disposal, transport, or handling of pollutants, contaminants, or hazardous or toxic materials or wastes, and including all Environmental Permits and agreements and duties issued under or imposed by such Laws Environmental Permits means, collectively, all licenses, permits and other authorizations or registrations required under any and all Environmental Laws. Event of Default has the meaning given in Section 2.22. Facilities has the meaning given in Section 2.21. FERC means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission and any successor entity. Fiscal Year means the calendar year. Force Majeure has the meaning given in Section 2.26. Indemnified Cotenant has the meaning set forth in Section 2.10. Indemnifying Cotenant has the meaning set forth in Section 2.10. Independent Technical Advisor means Power Engineers, which Independent Technical Advisor may be removed or replaced by a qualified engineering firm that is not affiliated with any Cotenant upon the affirmative vote of a majority of the voting interests of the Cotenants in accordance with Section 3.7. Information has the meaning given in Section 2.28. Interconnection Agreement means that certain Standard Large Generator Interconnection Agreement entered into among Wildorado I, the Interconnector and Transmission Owner, dated as of December 22, 2005, as such agreement may be amended from time to time. Interconnection Assignment Agreement has the meaning set forth in the recitals. Interconnector means Southwest Power Pool, Inc. (SPP), a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of Arkansas. Interconnector Substation means the substation owned by Transmission Owner and operated by the Interconnector (including the revenue meter), located approximately nine and one half (9.5) miles from the Shared Switching Station to which the Common Physical Facilities will be interconnected. Laws means all applicable laws, statutes, ordinances, rules, regulations, decrees, orders, permits, requirements, judgments, decisions and injunctions issued by any governmental authority, including laws relating to health, safety and the environment. Manager means Wildorado I and its permitted successors succeeding to the role of Manager under this Agreement. Maximum Nameplate Capacity means, as of any date of determination, the aggregate sum of the maximum nameplate capacity ratings of each wind turbine generator included in a Project that has been interconnected to the Interconnector Substation through the Common Physical Facilities as of the date of such determination. MW means a megawatt or megawatts, as the context may require. NERC means the North American Electric Reliability Corporation, and any successor entity serving as the Electric Reliability Organization as certified by FERC. Non-Pledging Cotenant has the meaning given in Section 4.3. Party has the meaning given in the preamble to this Agreement. Person means any individual or entity, and the heirs, personal representatives, successors and assigns of such individual or entity where the context so permits. Pledging Cotenant has the meaning given in Section 4.3. Power Purchaser means Southwestern Public Service Company or any other entity purchasing electricity generated by a Project. Project Controlled Assets means, for each Cotenant, any of the assets comprising its respective Projects (including each such Projects transformer), the corresponding Project Lands and related Project agreements and contractual arrangements. For the avoidance of doubt, the Project Controlled Assets shall exclude any of the Common Facilities. Project Lands means, for any Project, the lands on which such Project is located. Projects means, collectively, the Wildorado I Project and the Wildorado II Project. Prudent Wind Industry Practices means any of the practices, methods, equipment, specifications, and standards of care, skill, safety and diligence, as the same may change from time to time, but applied in light of the facts known at the time, as are generally applied or utilized under comparable circumstances by experienced and prudent professionals in respect of the management and operation of wind energy transmission facilities of comparable type and complexity to the Common Facilities. Prudent Wind Industry Practices do not necessarily mean the best practice, method, or standard of care, skill, safety and diligence in all cases, but is instead intended to encompass a range of acceptable practices, methods, and standards. Public Utility Commission of Texas means the Public Utility Commission of Texas and any successor entity. Shared Expenses means any expenses necessary or beneficial for the operation and maintenance of the Common Facilities, including, without limitation: All fees and expenses payable under the Interconnection Agreement, the Common On Call and Maintenance Agreement and the other Shared Project Agreements. All costs and expenses for operating period insurance under any blanket policy purchased by or on behalf of the Cotenants with respect to the Common Facilities. The fixed costs payable under any and all contracts for the purchase of backfeed power to supply station load for all the Projects, when and if such contract is single-billed to all Cotenants. Property and other use and/or ad valorem taxes assessed or allocated to the Common Facilities. Fees, if any, charged by FERC or any other regulatory authority, including SPP or NERC, or the issuers of the Shared Licenses and Permits, to the Cotenants with respect to the construction, use or operation of Common Facilities. Reasonable out-of-pocket and overhead expenses of the Manager incurred in connection with the performance of its services under this Agreement and approved in accordance with Section 3.5. Other shared expenses identified from time to time in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, including any costs to decommission and remove the Common Physical Facilities. Shared Licenses and Permits means, collectively, the governmental licenses, permits, approvals and authorizations, whether federal, state or local, including Environmental Permits, necessary for and relating to the Common Facilities. Shared Project Agreements means, collectively, the Interconnection Agreement (through the Cotenants ownership of Wildorado Interconnect), the Common On Call and Maintenance Agreement and all other agreements entered into by or on behalf of the Cotenants relating to the ownership and/or operation of the Common Facilities. For the avoidance of doubt, the Shared Project Agreements shall exclude any agreements entered into by a Cotenant or its affiliates with respect to such Cotenants respective Project, Project Controlled Assets and Project Lands. Shared Real Property Documents means, collectively, the transmission land rights, easements and permits, and all other option agreements, leases, subordination agreements and other real property agreements, in each case entered into, or to be entered into, by or on behalf of the Cotenants that create or evidence any real property interests relating to the Common Facilities, an undivided ownership share legal interest in all of which is jointly owned, as tenants-in-common, by the Cotenants. The Shared Real Property Documents in effect on the date hereof, as well as the underlying tracts related thereto, are more particularly described in Exhibit B hereto. For the avoidance of doubt, the Shared Real Property Documents shall exclude any easements, option agreements, leases, subordination agreements and other real property agreements entered into by a Cotenant or its affiliates with respect to such Cotenants respective Project, Project Controlled Assets and Project Lands. Shared Switching Station means the switchyard, and all construction, design and other agreements related thereto to be constructed by Wildorado II in accordance with this Agreement on or prior to the interconnection of the Wildorado II Project, an undivided ownership share legal interest in which is to be jointly owned, as tenants-in-common, by the Cotenants pursuant to this Agreement. Sharing Ratio means, with respect to each Cotenant, the ratio equal to the aggregate Maximum Nameplate Capacity of such Cotenants respective Project over the Maximum Nameplate Capacity of all Projects, calculated, with respect to any Project, as of the commercial operation date of such Project; provided that each Cotenants Sharing Ratio shall be adjusted in the event that there is a material and permanent increase or decrease in the Maximum Nameplate Capacity of its Project. Side Letters means, collectively, the (i) letter agreement to be entered into between each Cotenant, Wildorado Interconnect, the Interconnector and the Transmission Owner, regarding certain transmission clarifications in respect of the Interconnection Agreement and (ii) letter agreement to be entered into between each Cotenant and Southwestern Public Service Company. Technical Committee means that committee consisting of the Wildorado I Representative and the Wildorado II Representative, as set forth in Section 2.5. Transfer means, with respect to any asset of a Party, the sale, assignment, transfer, pledge, encumbrance, transfer, pledge, or other disposition of, either voluntarily, by operation of law or otherwise, or such asset. Transmission Owner or Xcel Energy means Southwestern Public Service Company (d/b/a Xcel Energy), a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of New Mexico. Upgrade Completion Date has the meaning given in Section 2.4. Undivided Interest means the undivided rights and interests of each Cotenant in the Common Facilities. Utility Service has the meaning given in Section 2.31. Wildorado I means Wildorado Wind, LLC, a limited liability company organized and existing under the laws of the State of Texas. Wildorado I Lenders shall mean the lenders, administrative agent and collateral agent to Wildorado I pursuant to that certain Amended and Restated Credit Agreement dated as of July 21, 2009, among Viento Funding II, Inc., Edison Mission Midwest, Inc., Mission Wind New Mexico, Inc., Mission Wind Texas, Inc., Mission Wind Wildorado, Inc., BNP Paribas, West LB, and the other lenders party thereto, as amended from time to time. Wildorado I Project means that certain wind farm located in Oldham, Potter and Randall Counties, Texas, with a Maximum Nameplate Capacity of 161 MW. Wildorado I Representative means the person that Wildorado I may designate from time to time, provided that Wildorado I shall notify the Cotenants of its initial designee promptly upon such designation. Wildorado II means Wildorado Wind II, LLC, a limited liability company organized and existing under the laws of the State of Texas. Wildorado II Expenses means any and all expenses necessary for the construction of the Wildorado II Project, including, without limitation, (i) any and all costs of the Wildorado I Project and the Wildorado II Project arising out of construction of the Shared Switching Station, (ii) any and all costs of any necessary or required modifications to the Common Physical Facilities to accommodate the Wildorado II Project, and (iii) any and all fees and expenses payable to amend the Common On Call and Maintenance Agreement and the other Shared Project Agreements to provide for the addition of the Wildorado II Project. Wildorado II Project means, collectively, the wind power generation facilities to be developed by Wildorado II (or Wildorado IIs successors, assigns or affiliates) in the vicinity of the Wildorado I Project with an aggregate Maximum Nameplate Capacity of all such facilities not to exceed 79 MW. Wildorado II Representative means Nabil Farah or such other person as Wildorado II may designate from time to time. Wildorado Interconnect means Wildorado Interconnect, LLC, a limited liability company organized and existing under the laws of the State of Texas. Withdrawal Costs has the meaning given in Section 6.3. COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENTS Cotenants Intent. Each Cotenant has an undivided ownership share legal interest, as tenants-in-common, in the Common Facilities and has acquired its Undivided Interest, and has executed this Agreement in order to provide for the acquisition, ownership, development, operation and maintenance of the Common Facilities. The Cotenants hereby declare that (i) the Common Facilities shall be held and used solely to permit the interconnection of the Projects and related transmission of electricity generated by or on behalf of the Cotenants (or by their successors, assigns or affiliates) from Project Lands to the Interconnector Substation; (ii) each Cotenant has the right to utilize the Common Facilities only up to its Common Facilities Percentage Interest; and (iii) no Cotenant is providing utility service, transmission service or interconnection service to any other Cotenant. No Person may be admitted as a Cotenant without the unanimous written consent of all then existing Cotenants. Notwithstanding any provision contained herein to the contrary, and without limiting any other conditions imposed pursuant to this Agreement, prior to the admission of any new Cotenant, each of the then existing Cotenants must have received a written instrument, in form and substance acceptable to such then existing Cotenants, signed by or on behalf of the new Cotenant containing the new Cotenants express acceptance of and agreement to be bound by all terms and conditions of this Agreement. Each Cotenants Sharing Ratio shall be modified as the Cotenants agree is appropriate from time to time to reflect the admission of new Cotenants. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, the Cotenants hereby declare their intent that, in accordance with the Bushorado Letter Agreement, Bushorado shall become a Cotenant upon the approval by the Cotenants of the design of the required technical changes to the Common Facilities to accommodate the Bushorado Project and the agreement upon applicable amendments to this Agreement. Development and Construction of Wildorado II Project. Wildorado II is currently planning the development, construction, financing and operation of an approximately 79 MW Maximum Nameplate Capacity wind energy electric generating facility to be located on the Wildorado II Project Lands. Wildorado II shall decide in its sole discretion whether or not to proceed with the development and construction of the Wildorado II Project and Wildorado I acknowledges that Wildorado II retains this discretion. Should Wildorado II choose to proceed with the development and construction of the Wildorado II Project, Wildorado II must also proceed with the development and construction of and improvements to the Shared Switching Station (which Shared Switching Station shall be deemed to be included in the Common Facilities) and Wildorado II agrees that all costs arising out of such development and construction shall be borne by Wildorado II. The Cotenants agree that the Common Physical Facilities have been designed and/or constructed (or will be re-designed and constructed) with sufficient bus, space, safety, security, and other facilities to permit acceptance of electric power from transformers separately owned by Wildorado I and Wildorado II (or their successors, assigns and affiliates). Collectively, all such transformers shall have an aggregate nameplate capacity equal to the Design Capacity. Wildorado II shall provide Wildorado I with the proposed plans and requirements with respect to the interconnection of the Wildorado II Project to the Common Facilities, including the proposed Projects Maximum Nameplate Capacity, schedule and needs for interconnection to the Common Facilities. Wildorado II shall have the right to propose to install any upgrades or additional design or operational components to the Common Physical Facilities at its sole cost and expense. Wildorado II shall cooperate with Wildorado I, the Manager and the Technical Committee to review, approve and coordinate plans to assemble, construct and/or install the Shared Switching Station and any applicable Project Controlled Assets within the Shared Switching Station and to install meters, bus interfaces and other interconnection equipment and any other upgrades and/or additional operational components in and with the Common Physical Facilities. Wildorado II acknowledges that all planning, construction and installation of interconnection and transmission facilities required for the Wildorado II Project, including the Shared Switching Station, or such upgrades and additional design or operational components shall be conducted pursuant to prudent engineering and construction practices and in a manner that will not interfere with the normal operation and maintenance of any Project then existing; provided, that the Parties acknowledge and agree that the construction and installation of the interconnection and transmission facilities may result in unscheduled outages and/or curtailment of some or all of the energy production from a Project then existing (which lost revenues (including the cash value of any lost federal production tax credits), costs and/or expenses Wildorado II shall be solely responsible for pursuant to the terms of this Agreement). As part of the process for interconnection of the Wildorado II Project to the Common Physical Facilities, the Cotenants shall establish a protocol for minimizing disruptions to any other Project that is interconnected to the Common Physical Facilities. Wildorado II shall be solely responsible for: (i) its costs of interconnecting with the Common Physical Facilities and (ii) any costs, expenses or revenue loss incurred (including the cash value of any lost federal production tax credits) by any Cotenant owning a Project then interconnected with the Common Physical Facilities in connection with the construction, installation, startup, testing, interconnection and/or operation of the Wildorado II Project (including any penalties imposed on Wildorado Interconnect or any Cotenant owning a Project then existing or damages payable to a Power Purchaser or the Interconnector by Wildorado Interconnect or any Cotenant). Each Cotenant will exercise commercially reasonable efforts to mitigate the effect of any disruption in service caused during the process of interconnection of the Wildorado II Project to the Common Physical Facilities. Wildorado II shall reimburse any other Cotenants for any such costs, expenses and/or revenue losses within five (5) business days after the receipt of an invoice for the same. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, any additional facilities or operational components and/or upgrades, modifications or improvements to the existing Common Facilities that are constructed or acquired by Wildorado II, including, but not limited to, the Shared Switching Station, shall be: (i) procured by Wildorado II for and on behalf of itself and the other Cotenants, (ii) added as Common Facilities hereunder and deemed incorporated into, and governed by, the terms hereof and (iii) held in undivided ownership share ownership interests, as tenants-in-common, by the Cotenants. At the request of any Cotenant, the Parties shall execute such documents as are necessary or desirable to document such ownership. Initial Sharing Ratio. It is understood and agreed that until commencement of construction of the Wildorado II Project, Wildorado Is Sharing Ratio shall be 100%. Upon commencement of construction of the Wildorado II Project and until the date of commercial operation of the Wildorado II Project, Wildorado II shall bear all costs of the construction of and/or improvements to the Shared Switching Station and the other Common Physical Facilities, and all incremental operating costs of the Cotenants incurred as a result of the interconnection of the Wildorado II Project. As currently contemplated, upon the commercial operation date of the Wildorado II Project, Wildorado Is Sharing Ratio shall be 67.08% and Wildorado IIs Sharing Ratio shall be 32.92% (such ratios being subject to adjustment as provided in the definition of Sharing Ratio contained herein), and the Cotenants shall share expenses in accordance with Section 2.7 . Priority of Use. The Parties acknowledge and agree that: (a) Prior to the completion of (i) any system network upgrades as may be required for interconnection and transmission service by the Interconnector or the Transmission Owner, and (ii) all improvements and upgrades to the Common Facilities necessary to accommodate the use thereof by Wildorado II without causing adverse impacts on Wildorado I (the Upgrade Completion Date), in the event of any system emergency or other need for curtailment of interconnection services, transmission services or use of the Common Facilities, the Wildorado I Project shall be the last Project to be curtailed or disconnected and the first Project to be permitted to use the Common Facilities. (b) From and after the Upgrade Completion Date, in the event of any system emergency or other need for curtailment of interconnection services, transmission services or use of the Common Facilities, the Manager shall curtail the proper project according to the specific curtailment instructions from the Transmission Owner and Interconnector and, in the absence of specific instructions: (i) if the Wildorado I Project (or the purchaser of its energy) and the Wildorado II Project (or the purchaser of its energy) have differing levels of transmission service, the Project with the lowest level of transmission service priority shall be (x) the first Project to be curtailed or disconnected, (y) allocated all necessary curtailment obligations, up to its maximum nameplate capacity, prior to the curtailment of the other Project and (z) the last Project to be permitted to use the Common Facilities following any such curtailment or disconnection; (ii) if either the Wildorado I Project (or the purchaser of its energy) and the Wildorado II Project (or the purchaser of its energy) have procured the same levels of transmission service, the impact of such system emergency or curtailment shall be applied pro rata to the Cotenants in accordance with their Sharing Ratios; and (c) To the extent any such curtailment or disconnection is directly caused by an act or omission of any Cotenant or the breach by a Cotenant of this Agreement, then, notwithstanding subsections (b)(i) and (b)(ii) above, (y) such Cotenants Project shall be the first Project to be curtailed or disconnected and the last Project to be permitted to use the Common Facilities, and (z) such Cotenant shall be solely responsible for any and all lost revenues, costs and/or expenses (including the cash value of any lost federal production tax credits) incurred by the other Cotenants for any curtailment of some or all of the energy production attributable to such act, omission or breach. Such Cotenants Project shall not be permitted to use the Common Facilities again unless and until the Independent Technical Advisor certifies to the Technical Committee that the deficiencies have been corrected, or the Technical Committee otherwise agrees. (d) Each Cotenant shall provide the Manager, Wildorado Interconnect and each other Cotenant with (i) written notice of its Projects initial level of interconnection or transmission service priority within thirty (30) days after the later of the (x) Effective Date and (y) the date such level of service priority is first established and (ii) prior written notice of any subsequent changes in its Projects level of interconnection or transmission service priority. The Manager shall not be responsible for altering the relative curtailment priority of the Projects pursuant to this Section until such notice has been received. Technical Committee. Wildorado I hereby appoints and authorizes the Wildorado I Representative and Wildorado II hereby appoints and authorizes the Wildorado II Representative to act as its representative to the technical committee formed hereunder (the Technical Committee). The Technical Committee shall have such powers as are expressly delegated to the Technical Committee in this Agreement or as may be given to it by unanimous consent of the Cotenants, together with such other powers as are reasonably incidental thereto. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, the Technical Committee shall not be required to take any action which is contrary to this Agreement or any law or that exposes the Technical Committee to any liability. All decisions and determinations to be made by the Technical Committee shall be made by unanimous vote of its members; provided however, that to the extent the members of the Technical Committee are unable to reach agreement on a matter within a commercially reasonable period, any member of the Technical Committee may, upon notice to the other members, elect to have the matter referred to the Independent Technical Advisor. Within one (1) business day of notice of such election, the Technical Committee shall refer the matter to the Independent Technical Advisor. The Independent Technical Advisor will promptly make a determination as to each of the items in dispute, which must be (i) in writing, (ii) furnished to each Cotenant and (iii) made in accordance with this Agreement, and which determination, absent manifest error, will be conclusive and binding on all Cotenants. The Independent Technical Advisor shall make its determinations based on prudent engineering practices, the provisions of this Agreement, and the general principle that the operation of the Wildorado I Project should not be materially adversely affected by the interconnection of the Wildorado II Project (except to the extent that such effect is reasonably expected to be incurred in the construction and operation of shared interconnection facilities, the financial consequence to Wildorado I is mitigated by payments or indemnification by Wildorado II, and such effect is not of a long term duration). Each Cotenant shall use reasonable efforts to cause the Independent Technical Advisor to render its decision as soon as reasonably practicable, including by promptly complying with all reasonable requests by the Independent Technical Advisor. The fees and expenses of the Independent Technical Advisor shall be borne equally by the Cotenants. The Cotenants shall pay all reasonable out-of-pocket costs and expenses of the Technical Committee in the performance of their duties hereunder (including the reasonable fees and disbursements of a single counsel for the Technical Committee (but not any fees or disbursements of more than one counsel for the Technical Committee)). The Technical Committee shall provide the Cotenants with copies of the designs, plans and specifications for the Common Physical Facilities for review and comment, but the Technical Committee retains the right to make all final design decisions with respect to such designs, plans and specifications consistent with prudent engineering and construction practices. If a Cotenant proposes any upgrades and/or additional design or operational components to the design of the Common Physical Facilities, the Technical Committee shall review each proposal in good faith. If the Technical Committee determines that any such proposal is not likely to have a material adverse effect on the Common Physical Facilities, the Wildorado I Project or the Wildorado II Project, the Technical Committee shall agree to allow the applicable Cotenant(s) to incorporate such proposals. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, any such additional facilities or operational components and/or upgrades, modifications or improvements to the existing Common Facilities that are constructed or acquired pursuant to this Section shall be: (i) procured by the applicable Cotenant for and on behalf of itself and the other Cotenants, (ii) added as Common Facilities hereunder and deemed incorporated into, and governed by, the terms hereof and (iii) held in undivided ownership share ownership interests, as tenants-in-common, by the Cotenants. At the request of any Cotenant, the Parties shall execute such documents as are necessary or desirable to document such ownership. Rights to Common Facilities. Each Cotenant retains the right to hold and utilize its Common Facilities Percentage Interest, to (a) connect its Project to the Common Facilities up to its respective Common Facilities Percentage Interest and (b) deliver or receive electrical energy corresponding to such Common Facilities Percentage Interest in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. No Cotenant is providing any transmission, interconnection or utility service to any other Cotenant. Shared Expenses and Line Losses. Each Cotenant hereby confirms its obligation to share in the periodic payment of Shared Expenses, and agrees, severally but not jointly, to pay its respective share of the Shared Expenses, as and when due and payable. As of the commercial operation date of each Cotenants Project, such Cotenants respective share of the Shared Expenses shall equal its Sharing Ratio multiplied by the total Shared Expenses. The Cotenants shall cause the Manager, as authorized agent for each Cotenant, to administer the collection and payment of the Shared Expenses, whether invoiced by each expense payee against a particular Project or invoiced as an aggregate expense of all Cotenants. Each Cotenant shall pay each such invoice for Shared Expenses promptly upon, and in any event within thirty (30) days of, receipt of written notice thereof from the Manager. As it becomes practicable and desirable, the Cotenants from time to time may designate additional expenses as Shared Expenses to be administered by the Manager in accordance with this Section 2.7 to the extent such additional expenses are similar to the other Shared Expenses. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Wildorado II hereby confirms its obligation to pay the Wildorado II Expenses. Any line losses occurring between the Shared Switching Station and the Interconnector Substation that cannot be specifically allocated to the operation of one Project (i.e., as when only one Project is operating) shall be allocated to the Cotenants so that any and all incremental line losses over and above those resulting from the operation of the Wildorado I Project shall be allocated to Wildorado II. For the avoidance of doubt, such allocation of line losses shall reflect the incremental contribution of losses caused by the injection of electric current from the Wildorado II Project, where line losses are proportional to the square of the electric currents injected by both Projects, multiplied by the conductor and transformer resistance of the line. Automated equipment capable of measuring and recording the line losses attributable to each project shall be installed as part of the initial construction of the Shared Switching Station and thereafter maintained at the Shared Switching Station as part of the Common Physical Facilities. Any imbalance charges, charges for reactive power or other charges incurred under the Interconnection Agreement that result from the operation of a Project that are reasonably allocable (based on output of energy or reactive power, or some other objective criteria) to a given Project shall be paid by such Project and shall not be Shared Expenses. Any network upgrade credits available under the Interconnection Agreement and any other monies paid by the Interconnector under the Interconnection Agreement with respect to the Wildorado I Project shall be paid to Wildorado I. Any monies paid by the Interconnector under the Interconnection Agreement with respect to the Wildorado II Project shall be paid to Wildorado II. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, all costs, expenses and/or liabilities incurred by the Manager or any Cotenant that are attributed to the construction, initial start-up, testing and/or interconnection of a Project shall be the sole cost of such Project. Any monies paid by the Manager or any other Cotenant with respect to such items shall be promptly reimbursed by the applicable Cotenant. Interconnection Agreement. Wildorado I confirms that the Interconnection Agreement was entered into by Wildorado I. Pursuant to the Interconnection Assignment Agreement, Wildorado I assigned the Interconnection Agreement to Wildorado Interconnect. Wildorado Interconnect shall hold the Interconnection Agreement for, and on behalf of, the Cotenants, and in recognition thereof, the Interconnection Agreement shall constitute part of the Common Facilities. Wildorado Interconnect and each Cotenant shall comply with all provisions of the Interconnection Agreement, including any directives of the Interconnector issued thereunder, applicable to such Cotenants Project. Wildorado Interconnect is hereby authorized to act as agent, or appoint a third party to act as agent, for all Cotenants in any matters relating to the Interconnection Agreement. Promptly upon receipt of any notice from the Interconnector to Wildorado Interconnect with respect to a Cotenant or its Project, Wildorado Interconnect shall deliver such notice to such Cotenant and the Manager. Promptly upon receipt of any notice from the Interconnector to Wildorado Interconnect or a Cotenant of any default (or any other event) which could give rise to an exercise of remedies, including disconnection of any Project or termination by the Interconnector of the Interconnection Agreement, Wildorado Interconnect or such Cotenant, as appropriate, shall deliver written notice of the same to the Technical Committee and to the Manager and the Cotenants, as the case may be. The Technical Committee shall promptly after the receipt of such notice, determine the appropriate course of action, which course of action may include without limitation, the disconnection of a Project and cause the applicable Cotenant or Cotenants to implement such course of action. Prior to the commercial operation of a Project other than the Wildorado I Project, each Cotenant agrees to enter into good faith negotiations with the other Cotenants, the Interconnector and any other entity that may provide interconnection services for a Project in order to reallocate interconnection capacity under the Interconnection Agreement if necessary, provided, however, in no event shall the allocation of capacity to the Wildorado I Project be less than 161 MW. No Cotenant is providing any interconnection, transmission or electric utility services to the other Cotenants under this Agreement, and no Cotenant shall have any obligation to the other Cotenants to provide any interconnection or related rights with the Interconnector. Maximum Projects to Interconnect. No Cotenant shall interconnect any Project to the Shared Switching Station to the extent such interconnection will result in (i) in the case of Wildorado I, Wildorado I having a Project with a Maximum Nameplate Capacity in excess of 161 MW, and (ii) in the case of Wildorado II, Wildorado II having a Project with a Maximum Nameplate Capacity in excess of 79 MW (as such amount may be adjusted pursuant to this Agreement). To the extent that conditions exist that could result in a Cotenant delivering energy from its respective Project to its respective Project meter in excess the respective amounts set forth in the foregoing clauses (i) and (ii) and if such excess generation causes such Cotenant to be in noncompliance with the Interconnection Agreement and/or interferes with the other Cotenants rights to utilize its Common Facilities Percentage Interest in the Common Facilities, then such Cotenant shall curtail the operation of its Project so as not to exceed its applicable amount. If a Cotenant proposes any upgrades and/or additional design or operational components to the design of the Common Physical Facilities (including in connection with the initial construction and operation of the Wildorado II Project), the other Cotenant shall review each proposal in good faith. If the other Cotenant determines that any such proposal shall not have a material adverse effect on the Common Physical Facilities or on the existing projects, the Cotenant, in its sole discretion, may agree to allow the incorporation of such proposals into the design of the Common Physical Facilities. Unless otherwise agreed by the other Cotenant in writing, the proposing Cotenant shall be solely responsible for: (i) the costs of any such upgrades and/or additional design or operational components and the cost of any third party experts retained to study or review the proposed upgrades and (ii) any costs, expenses or revenue loss incurred (including the cash value of any lost federal production tax credits) by any other Cotenant owning a Project then existing in connection with the construction, installation, startup, testing and/or interconnection of any such upgrades and/or additional design or operational components (including any penalties imposed on any other Cotenant owning a Project then existing or damages payable to a Power Purchaser or the Interconnector by Wildorado Interconnect or any other Cotenant). The proposing Cotenant shall reimburse any other Cotenant for any such costs, expenses and/or revenue losses within five (5) business days after the receipt of an invoice for the same. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, any such additional facilities or operational components and/or upgrades, modifications or improvements to the existing Common Facilities that are constructed or acquired pursuant to this Section shall be: (i) procured by the applicable Cotenant for and on behalf of itself and the other Cotenants, (ii) added as Common Facilities hereunder and deemed incorporated into, and governed by, the terms hereof and (iii) held in undivided ownership share ownership interests, as tenants-in-common, by the Cotenants. At the request of any Cotenant, the Parties shall execute such documents as are necessary or desirable to document such ownership. Indemnity. General Indemnity. Each Cotenant (an Indemnifying Cotenant) shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless the other Cotenants (an Indemnified Cotenant) from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, claims, judgments, liens, penalties, costs and expenses, including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys and consultants fees, which may be imposed upon or incurred by such Indemnified Cotenant or asserted against such Indemnified Cotenant by any third person or entity in connection with any breach of this Agreement (including any failure of such Indemnifying Cotenant to comply with the Interconnection Agreement as applicable to such Indemnifying Cotenants Project) or any negligent or willful acts or omissions of or on behalf of the Indemnifying Cotenant or with respect to its Project Controlled Assets. Operational Indemnity. Each Indemnifying Cotenant shall additionally indemnify, defend and hold harmless each Indemnified Cotenant from and against any costs, expenses or revenue loss incurred (including the cash value of any lost federal production tax credits and any penalties imposed on the Indemnified Cotenant owning a Project then existing or damages payable to a Power Purchaser or the Interconnector by the Indemnified Cotenant) by such Indemnified Cotenant owning a Project then existing caused by any breach of this Agreement (including any failure of such Indemnifying Cotenant to comply with the Interconnection Agreement as applicable to such Indemnifying Cotenants Project). The Indemnifying Cotenant shall pay all undisputed costs, expenses and/or revenue losses within five (5) business days after the receipt of an invoice for the same. Any amounts paid as indemnification under this Section shall take account of any income tax resulting from the receipt of the indemnity payment and any tax affects resulting from the event that gave rise to such payment such that the Indemnified Cotenants after-tax position shall be unaffected. Environmental Compliance. Each Cotenant with respect to its Project Controlled Assets, shall be responsible for complying with all Environmental Laws and Environmental Permits and shall be responsible for all investigations, studies, clean up, corrective action or response or remedial action required by any governmental authority now or hereafter authorized to regulate environmental or other matters or by any consent decree or court or administrative order now or hereafter applicable to such Cotenants use, operation or ownership of its Project Controlled Assets. No Waste or Nuisance; Maintenance; No Interference. No Cotenant shall use or permit the use of the Common Facilities in any manner that would create waste or nuisance, or that would increase the rate, or jeopardize the issuance or maintenance, of any insurance policy relating to the Common Facilities, nor otherwise conduct or cause to be conducted operations on its Project Lands which would have similar effects on, or otherwise damage or interfere with, the Common Facilities. The Manager and each Cotenant shall also perform all necessary repairs and/or other maintenance activities related to the Common Physical Facilities in an expeditious manner so as to minimize Project downtime, maximize Project revenue, and otherwise reduce ultimate repair costs and damages, including, but not limited to, scheduling such repairs during down times or low wind periods. Liens; Sales. No Cotenant shall, directly or indirectly, create, incur or permit to exist any lien on or encumbrance to be levied against or attached to the Common Facilities or the Undivided Interest of any other Cotenant, including but not limited to any lien for unpaid taxes, any judgment lien or any mechanics or materialmens lien, except in accordance with this Agreement. If any such lien or encumbrance attaches or a Cotenant receives notice of any such lien or encumbrance, the Cotenant whose actual or alleged act or omission resulted in such lien or encumbrance shall cause such lien or encumbrance to be released and removed of record within fifteen (15) days of such attachment or notice, unless (a) such Cotenant (i) in good faith contests or disputes the validity of such liens or encumbrances, (ii) promptly commences legal action to remove such lien or encumbrance and (iii) furnishes to the other Cotenants a bond or other acceptable security in an amount sufficient to discharge all such contested liens and encumbrances and (b) during such period the lienholders proceedings are stayed. Each Cotenant further agrees not to sell, lease, convey, transfer and/or assign, or to enter into any agreement with respect to, the sale, lease, conveyance, transfer or assignment of any of the Common Facilities. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in accordance with Article IV, a Cotenant may grant a lien on or security interest in its Undivided Interest or any right to payments under the Interconnection Agreement with respect to such Cotenants Project. Taxes. Each Cotenant shall pay all real and personal property taxes and assessments, general or special, levied against its Project and/or the facilities and fixtures located thereon, except that any taxes or assessments that are levied on the Common Facilities shall be treated and paid as Shared Expenses. All such taxes and assessments shall be paid before delinquency and before any fine, interest or penalty shall become due or be imposed for their non-payment. Operation and Management. Each Cotenant is required to operate and maintain its Project and/or Project Controlled Assets acting as a prudent operator and manager and otherwise: (a) in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Interconnection Agreement, (b) in accordance with good operating and utility industry practices, (c) in compliance with all Laws, and (d) without causing a material adverse effect on the Common Facilities, any other Cotenant or any of the other Cotenants Project. The Manager shall have the power and authority to disconnect the Project of a Cotenant: (a) for failure to operate and maintain its Project and/or Project Controlled Assets in accordance with this Agreement, (b) if the Manager determines, in its reasonable discretion, that disconnection is necessary in the event of an emergency, or (c) at the direction of the Interconnector pursuant to its rights under the Interconnection Agreement. The Manager shall promptly provide notice to the relevant Cotenant concurrently with disconnecting its Project or as soon thereafter as is reasonably practical. Any Project disconnected shall be reconnected when the specific default is cured in full. Manager. In addition to the Managers duties pursuant to Article III, certain additional administrative functions relating to the Common Facilities shall be administered by the Manager, including, but not limited to: (i) coordinating the payment of any Shared Expenses with respect to the Common Facilities pursuant to Section 2.7, or any other applicable provision of this Agreement; (ii) providing written notices to Cotenants of any such Shared Expenses and advising the Cotenants of their respective share of the Shared Expenses owed, which the Cotenants shall pay in accordance with Section 2.7; (iii) arranging for joint property insurance for the Common Facilities (with the approval of the Cotenants) at the expense of the Cotenants and paid in accordance with Section 2.7; provided that the cost of insuring each Cotenants revenue losses shall be borne entirely by the respective Cotenant; and (iv) making any necessary or desirable regulatory filings with respect to this Agreement and the subject matter thereof, including any filings with FERC, NERC or SPP. Each Cotenant shall be entitled to review any and all documentation and records related to any expenses with respect to the Common Facilities for which it is responsible for its pro rata share (as calculated in accordance with Section 2.7). The Manager shall have only such powers, duties and responsibilities as are set forth in this Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, during the period in which the Sharing Ratio of Wildorado I is one hundred percent (100%), the Manager shall not be permitted to do or take any of the following actions without the express prior written consent of all of the other Cotenants: Disposition of Assets. Selling, leasing, pledging, mortgaging, conveying, licensing, exchanging or otherwise transferring or disposing of any material property or assets comprising the Common Facilities, or amending the Shared Project Agreements, the Shared Licenses and Permits, the Shared Real Property Documents or the Interconnection Agreement; Borrowing. Borrowing any money on behalf of or in the name of the Cotenants, utilizing the Cotenants property as security for any loans, obligating the Cotenants as guarantors, endorsers, sureties or accommodation parties, or otherwise pledging the credit of the Cotenants in any way other than the incurring of trade accounts in the ordinary course of business (provided, however, nothing in this clause shall be deemed to prevent or prohibit any Cotenant from borrowing funds, issuing guarantees, or encumbering its assets, including its Undivided Interest, in connection with any corporate financing or any project financing of such Cotenants Project); Loans. Lending any money, or extending any credit, on behalf of or in the name of the Cotenants; Affiliate Contracts. Entering into agreements with affiliates of the Manager on behalf of the Cotenants; For the avoidance of doubt, during the period in which the Sharing Ratio of Wildorado II is greater than zero percent (0%), the Manager shall not be permitted to do or take any of the following actions without the express prior written consent of all of the other Cotenants: Disposition of Assets. Selling, leasing, pledging, mortgaging, conveying, licensing, exchanging or otherwise transferring or disposing of any material property or assets comprising the Common Facilities, or amending the Shared Project Agreements, the Shared Licenses and Permits, the Shared Real Property Documents or the Interconnection Agreement; Contracts. Making, entering into, executing, amending, modifying or supplementing any of the Shared Project Agreements on behalf of or in the name of the Cotenants; Expenditures. Making any expenditure on behalf of the Cotenants for any equipment, materials, assets or other items, or making any capital or other non-recurring expenditure, or consenting or agreeing to do any of the foregoing unless otherwise contemplated in the Shared Project Agreements or contemplated in the then applicable annual Budget proposed by the Manager and approved in writing by the Cotenants, provided, however, that the Manager may make reasonable expenditures beyond the applicable annual Budget to respond to an emergency and/or to comply with applicable Laws; Borrowing. Borrowing any money on behalf of or in the name of the Cotenants, utilizing the Cotenants property as security for any loans, obligating the Cotenants as guarantors, endorsers, sureties or accommodation parties, or otherwise pledging the credit of the Cotenants in any way other than the incurring of trade accounts in the ordinary course of business (provided, however, nothing in this clause shall be deemed to prevent or prohibit any Cotenant from borrowing funds, issuing guarantees, or encumbering its assets, including its Undivided Interest, in connection with any corporate financing or any project financing of such Cotenants Project); Loans. Lending any money, or extending any credit, on behalf of or in the name of the Cotenants; Lawsuits and Settlements. Settling, compromising, assigning, pledging, transferring, releasing or consenting to do the same, any claim, suit, debt, demand or judgment against, or due or by the Cotenants or the Manager on behalf of the Cotenants, submitting any such claim, dispute or controversy to arbitration or judicial process, or stipulation thereof to a judgment, or consent to do the same to the extent that any of the foregoing relate to an amount in controversy in excess of $1,000,000 (or the amount covered by applicable insurance proceeds); and Governing Authority. Taking any action contradictory to an express directive or instruction given by the Cotenants, so long as such directive or instruction does not violate any Laws, Shared Project Agreements, Shared Real Property Documents or Shared Licenses and Permits. Specific Authority of Manager. Subject to Section 2.16, the Manager shall have the power, without further consent or approval of the Cotenants: To employ from time to time, at the expense of the Cotenants, persons, firms or corporations to render services generally needed to accomplish the purposes of the Cotenants with respect to the Common Facilities; provided, that if the Manager retains any parties affiliated with the Manager for any of these purposes, the fees charged shall be based on the fair market value for similar services and the terms and conditions shall be on terms no less favorable than an agreement entered into on an arms length basis, and the Manager and the service provider shall provide a certificate to that effect; To pay and collect funds to pay Shared Expenses with respect to the Common Facilities in accordance with Section 2.7; To promptly provide any notices received by the Manager to the Cotenants with respect to the Common Facilities; and To execute, acknowledge, and deliver any and all documents and take such other steps as are reasonably necessary to effectuate the foregoing and as are consistent therewith. Indemnification of Manager. The Cotenants shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless, in proportion to their Sharing Ratio, the Manager, and its employees and agents, from any claim, loss, liability or damage incurred by reason of an act performed or omitted to be performed by it in good faith in connection with the management of the Common Facilities (other than acts or omissions constituting fraud, willful misconduct, or gross negligence), including reasonable attorneys fees incurred by it in connection with the defense of any action based on any such alleged act or omission. Manager Limitation of Liability. In the exercise of its duties hereunder, the Manager shall exercise such care, skill and diligence as a business entity engaged in the management of wind energy projects would normally exercise. The Manager shall not be liable, responsible or accountable in damages or otherwise to any Cotenant for any act performed in good faith by the Manager in the discharge of its duties hereunder as the Manager or in the exercise of its powers and authority hereunder as the Manager, except for acts or omissions constituting fraud, willful misconduct or gross negligence. Removal of Manager. The Manager may be removed for cause by any Cotenant; provided that each of the following conditions are satisfied: (a) the Manager has defaulted in its obligations under this Agreement; (b) the Cotenant seeking removal of the Manager for cause has provided written notice to the Manager and the other Cotenants of the default by the Manager hereunder, which notice shall contain a general description of the facts and circumstances giving rise to the default; and (c) the Manager has failed to cure any default described in the notice within thirty (30) days after delivery of such written notice; provided that, if the default is not reasonably capable of being cured within thirty (30) days, then the Manager shall have an additional period of time, but in no event more than ninety (90) days from the delivery of such written notice to cure such default. No removal of the Manager shall be effective unless and until a successor Manager is appointed by the Cotenants (such successor however may not be the Cotenant that has been acting as the removed Manager). Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary contained herein, no removal of a Party as the Manager shall affect such Partys rights as a Cotenant, and no default by a Party as the Manager shall constitute a default by that Party in its capacity as a Cotenant. Step-in Rights. If the Manager defaults in its obligations under this Agreement or fails to perform any of its material obligations under this Agreement, in each case, after the receipt of a written notice from the other Cotenants identifying such breach or non-performance and the expiration of a thirty (30) day cure period (which cure period may be extended for up to ninety (90) days if the breach or non-performance cannot reasonably be cured within such thirty (30) day period and the Manager is otherwise exercising commercially reasonable efforts to effectuate a cure or remedy such non-performance), then the other Cotenants shall have the right to step-in and effectuate such cure or perform on behalf of the Manager after the expiration of the relevant cure period. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, each Cotenant shall additionally have a license, on behalf of the Manager and the other Cotenants, to enter onto the property covered by the Shared Real Property Documents or other underlying real property interests to: (i) inspect any wind power facilities constructed or maintained thereon, including, but not limited to, the Common Physical Facilities, (ii) promptly implement, supervise, monitor, organize and undertake activities necessary to deal with emergency situations affecting the Common Physical Facilities involving risks to person or property or interfering with the normal operation of the Common Physical Facilities or the Projects, (iii) perform or install necessary or beneficial repairs and/or upgrades to the Common Physical Facilities which the Manger has failed to implement or undertake the following five (5) business days prior written notice from such Cotenant, and (iv) cure any breaches or defaults existing with respect to the Shared Real Property Documents. Events of Default; Default. If a Cotenant shall fail to perform its obligations hereunder or under any other agreement related to the Common Facilities in any material respect, then such failure shall constitute a default if not cured within (a) five (5) days after receipt of written notice of a payment default, (b) the period of time for cure provided in the Interconnection Agreement with respect to a default in performance of the Interconnection Agreement, or (c) thirty (30) days after such Cotenant has received written notice of any other default from a non-defaulting Cotenant; provided, however, that if the nature of the defaulted obligation or obligations (other than a default set forth in (a) or (b) above) is such that more than thirty (30) days are required, in the exercise of commercially reasonable diligence, for performance of such obligation(s), then such Cotenant shall not be in default if it commences such performance within such thirty (30) day period and thereafter continuously pursues the same to completion with commercially reasonable diligence, such extended period not to exceed ninety (90) days, including the initial cure period. Failure to cure within the cure periods set forth above shall result in an Event of Default. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, any notice of default shall not be effective, and the period of time within which the defaulting Cotenant may cure the noticed default shall not commence to run, unless and until a copy of said notice of default is provided to any lender or other financing entity who has a security interest in the defaulting Cotenants Undivided Interests, and who has given the Manager notice of such security interest. The nondefaulting Cotenants shall accept curative performance from any such lender or other financing entity within the stated time periods provided for the defaulting Cotenant. Remedies. In addition to all other remedies permitted by Law or under this Agreement (all of which shall be cumulative), following an Event of Default, the non-defaulting Cotenant and its lenders or other interest holders shall be entitled to pay any amounts due by the defaulting Cotenant, including, but not limited to, the defaulting Cotenants portion of the Shared Expenses, and/or perform the obligations of the defaulting Cotenant, and the defaulting Cotenant shall reimburse the performing Cotenants for any and all amounts paid and/or costs and expenses incurred in paying such amounts and/or rendering such performance, plus interest at the Default Rate. Further, the Technical Committee shall have the right to review the actions of the defaulting Cotenant and to determine whether the best interests of the Cotenants necessitate the disconnection of a Project. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, the Cotenants each acknowledge and agree that it would be prejudicial to the interests of the Cotenants under this Agreement if any Cotenant were to seek partition or any other type of division of the Common Facilities or file an action for such partition or division. Therefore, in consideration of such fact and for other good and valuable consideration, each of the Cotenants hereby waives and relinquishes any and all rights that it may have at any time or under any circumstance, including, with out limitation, after a default by a Cotenant hereunder, to seek a partition or any other type of division of the Common Facilities. Equitable Relief. The Cotenants agree that damages may be an inadequate remedy for a breach by the Manager or any Cotenant of its respective obligations under this Agreement, and that each Cotenant shall be entitled to seek injunctive and other equitable relief, including specific performance, against any other Cotenant or the Manager to prevent or eliminate any such default. Arbitration. All disputes arising under this Agreement will be governed exclusively and finally by mandatory and binding expedited arbitration. In the event a dispute arises between Cotenants (including the Manager), the aggrieved Cotenant shall promptly notify the other Cotenant of the dispute in writing. If the Cotenants fail to resolve the dispute within fifteen (15) days after delivery of such written notice, each Cotenant shall, within three (3) days of receipt of a written demand from the other party to do so, direct a designated representative to confer in good faith within five (5) days, to resolve the dispute. Should the Cotenants be unable to resolve the dispute to their mutual satisfaction within seven (7) days following such conference of designated representatives, each Cotenant shall have the right to pursue the resolution of such dispute by binding expedited arbitration under the Commercial Rules of Arbitration of the American Arbitration Association (AAA). The expedited arbitration will be concluded within sixty (60) days of the date of the demand for arbitration. Any Party shall have the right to apply to a court of competent jurisdiction for an injunction to protect its interests under this Agreement while the arbitration is pending. The arbitration panel shall consist of three (3) arbitrators, one (1) nominated by each of the respective Cotenants and the third nominated by the first two (2) arbitrators or, in the absence of agreement, by the AAA. This third arbitrator shall serve as the chairman of the arbitration panel. The place of arbitration shall be Los Angeles, California at a site chosen by the arbitration panel or, in the absence of agreement among the panel, at a site chosen by the arbitration chairman. Force Majeure. Force Majeure shall mean events, such as acts of God, the enforcement or adoption of legislation or lawful rules, regulations or orders of any governmental body adopted after the date of this Agreement, acts of the public enemy, riots, strikes, or other industrial disturbances, labor or material shortages, fires, explosions or other causes of a similar nature, which are beyond the reasonable control of the Cotenants and which wholly or partly prevent a Cotenant or Manager from performing their obligations under this Agreement. Effect of Force Majeure. If, because of an event of Force Majeure, either Cotenant or Manager is unable to carry out its obligations under this Agreement, and if such Cotenant or Manager promptly gives the Cotenant(s) and/or Manager written notice of such Force Majeure in detail, specifying the nature, extent and expected duration of such Force Majeure, the obligations and liabilities of the Cotenant or Manager giving such notice and the corresponding obligations and liabilities of any other Cotenant or Manager shall be temporarily suspended to the extent made necessary by and during the continuance of such Force Majeure. Any disabling effects of such Force Majeure shall be eliminated as soon as and to the extent reasonably practicable by the Cotenant or Manager claiming Force Majeure. Confidentiality of Cotenant Information. Each Cotenant agrees to maintain the confidentiality of the Information, except that Information may be disclosed (a) to its affiliates, managers, partners, directors, officers, employees, advisors, agents, consultants, lenders, and potential lenders, investors and purchasers to or of a Cotenant or any of its affiliates (and their respective advisors, consultants and counsel); it being understood that the Persons to whom such disclosure is made will be informed of the confidential nature of such Information and required to keep such Information confidential pursuant to a confidentiality agreement similar in nature to this Section, (b) to the extent requested by any regulatory authority having jurisdiction over the Cotenants, (c) to the extent required by applicable Laws or regulations or by any subpoena or similar legal process, (d) in any legal action or proceeding relating to this Agreement or the Common Facilities, or (e) to the extent such Information (i) becomes publicly available other than as a result of a breach of this Section or (ii) becomes available to any Cotenant on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the Cotenant to whom such Information relates. For purposes of this Agreement, Information means all information received pursuant to this Agreement or during the design, use or operation of the Common Facilities from a Cotenant or relating to a Cotenant or any of the Projects or businesses, other than any such information that is available to any Cotenant on a non-confidential basis prior to disclosure by the Cotenant to whom such Information relates, provided that, in the case of information received from a Cotenant after the date hereof, such information is clearly identified at the time of delivery as confidential. Rights to Electricity. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, all electricity transmitted on, over and/or through the Common Facilities, as well as any proceeds, income or revenue related thereto, shall belong solely to the Cotenant whose Project generated such electricity and no other Cotenant shall have any right or interest therein. Scheduling. The Cotenants shall, as necessary, develop a protocol with respect to scheduling of energy deliveries under the respective power purchase agreements relating to each Project. Each Cotenant shall bear any and all costs attributable to scheduling of energy from its Project. Cotenants Not an Electric Utility. The Cotenants are not providing interconnection, transmission or electric utility service (collectively Utility Service) to each other or any other Party under the terms of this Agreement. However, if a claim is made before the Public Utility Commission of Texas, FERC or any other governmental body that any or all of the Cotenants are providing Utility Service, the Cotenants shall cooperate in good faith to dispute such claim. Further, if the Public Utility Commission of Texas, FERC or other governmental body finds that any or all of the Cotenants are providing Utility Service, then the Cotenants shall negotiate in good faith to amend the terms of this Agreement, if possible, such that the Cotenants would not be providing Utility Service. FERC or Other Governmental Jurisdiction. On or prior to the Effective Date, Wildorado II will secure a legal opinion reasonably acceptable to Wildorado I that the Common Facilities are not jurisdictional transmission assets which require an independent Transmission Operator. For the purposes of this Section 2.32, the term Transmission Operator shall have the meaning set forth in the NERC standards, as the same may be amended from time to time. The Parties intend to utilize the Common Facilities in a manner not subject to FERC or NERC Transmission Operator or owner requirements. In the event that FERC or NERC determine that the Common Facilities are jurisdictional transmission assets which require an independent Transmission Operator, and such determination can be reversed by actions taken by the Parties, the Parties agree to cooperate in good faith to take such actions as may reasonably be undertaken by them to reverse the determination. In the event that, subsequent to the Effective Date, FERC or NERC determines that the Common Facilities are jurisdictional transmission assets which require an independent Transmission Operator, and such determination cannot be reversed by actions which may reasonably be undertaken by the Parties, Wildorado II will indemnify, hold harmless and defend Wildorado I and Wildorado Interconnect from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, claims, judgments, liens, penalties, costs and expenses, including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys and consultants fees, which may be imposed upon or incurred by or against them in connection with such determination. In addition, Wildorado II will secure an independent Transmission Operator for the Common Facilities. All costs, expenses or fees associated with the independent Transmission Operator and its operation and maintenance of the Common Facilities shall be for Wildorado IIs account (and shall not be Shared Expenses). Shared Expenses shall be reduced accordingly as appropriate. To the extent that such independent Transmission Operators scope replaces services that would otherwise have been provided by the Manager, the Manager shall not perform, and shall not be compensated for performing, such services. Any operator secured by Wildorado II pursuant to this Section 2.32 must be reasonably acceptable to Wildorado I and at least as qualified as Southwestern Public Service Company, a New Mexico corporation and independent transmission operator. The Manager shall have the power and authority to disconnect the Wildorado II Project for failure to comply with the provisions of this Section 2.32 if such failure is not cured within thirty (30) days following notice from the Manager. In such event, the Wildorado II Project shall be reconnected when the specific default is cured in full. Insurance Requirements of Wildorado II. On or prior to the Effective Date, Wildorado II will list Wildorado I, Wildorado Interconnect and the Wildorado I Lenders as additional insureds on its General Liability Policy ($1,000,000 per occurrence and $2,000,000 aggregate) plus excess liability coverage of $20,000,000, in a form reasonably acceptable to Wildorado I and Wildorado Interconnect. Such insurance shall not contain an exclusion for punitive or exemplary damages where insurable under law.
