Wildorado II will maintain such insurance for so long as Wildorado I and/or Wildorado Interconnect are potentially liable for the actions or inactions of Wildorado II affecting the Common Facilities or the Interconnection Agreement (whether through joint and several liability, guarantee arrangements, or otherwise). Such policies shall also include a severability of interest clause and cross liability clause. Prior to commencing construction of the Wildorado II Project, Wildorado II will list Wildorado I and the Wildorado I Lenders as additional insureds on its Builders Risk Policy and will attach a rider to that policy that will insure on an occurrence basis up to twelve (12) months of revenue lost by Wildorado I as a result of physical damage to the Common Facilities that is caused by actions or inactions of Wildorado II, in a form reasonably acceptable to Wildorado I. Wildorado II will be responsible for any deductible payable under the Builders All Risk or Wildorado Is policy if Wildorado I has to file a claim due to an insurable event caused by Wildorado II and not otherwise covered by Wildorado IIs Builder All Risk policy. The policy limits shall be sufficient to cover lost revenues relating to the 161 MW Wildorado Wind, LLC Renewable Energy Purchase Agreement as well as the pre-tax value of federal production tax credits, based on a 35% effective federal tax rate. Wildorado II will maintain such insurance until it is replaced with the policy described in subsection (c), below. Prior to commencing commercial operation of the Wildorado II Project, Wildorado II will list Wildorado I and the Wildorado I Lenders as additional insureds on its Contingent Business Interruption (CBI) insurance policy or if not a separate policy, the Property All-Risk (PAR) insurance policy and will attach a rider to that policy that will insure on an occurrence basis up to twelve (12) months of revenues lost by Wildorado I as a result of physical damage to the Common Facilities that is caused by the actions or inactions of Wildorado II, in a form reasonably acceptable to Wildorado I. Wildorado II will be responsible for any deductible payable under the CBI or PAR policy or Wildorado Is policy if Wildorado I has to file a claim due to an insurable event caused by Wildorado II and not otherwise covered by Wildorado IIs CBI or PAR policy. The policy limits shall be sufficient to cover lost revenues relating to the 161 MW Wildorado Wind, LLC Renewable Energy Purchase Agreement as well as the pre-tax value of federal production tax credits, based on a 35% effective federal tax rate. Wildorado II will maintain such insurance for so long as Wildorado I and/or Wildorado Interconnect are potentially liable for the actions or inactions of Wildorado II affecting the Common Facilities or the Interconnection Agreement (whether through joint and several liability, guarantee arrangements, or otherwise). In the event that the insurance described in Section 2.33(b) or (c) is not available on a commercially reasonable basis, Wildorado II may satisfy the requirements of those sections by either (A) posting and maintaining a letter of credit for the benefit of Wildorado I, in a form reasonably acceptable to Wildorado I, in an amount equal to the insurance coverage then required, which can be drawn by Wildorado I on terms substantially similar to the terms under which a claim could have been made under the required insurance coverage provided that the credit provider of the letter of credit shall be a U.S. bank or trust company that has a combined capital and surplus of at least $1 billion whose long term unsecured debt is rated A2 or higher by Moodys or A or higher by S&P (an LC Bank) or (B) providing a guaranty from a guarantor acceptable to Wildorado I (Guarantor), provided that the Guarantor has a senior unsecured credit rating (unenhanced by third-party support) equivalent to BBB+ or better as determined by both Standard & Poors and Moodys, or if either one or both of such ratings are not available, equivalent ratings from alternate rating sources acceptable to Wildorado I. In addition, if such senior unsecured credit rating (unenhanced by third party support) of the Guarantor is exactly equivalent to BBB+, the Guarantor must not be on credit watch or have a negative outlook by any rating agency giving a BBB+ rating. If the credit rating of the Guarantor is downgraded below BBB+ or if Wildorado I otherwise has commercially reasonable grounds to believe that there has been a material adverse change in the creditworthiness of the Guarantor, then Wildorado II shall be required to either (i) procure the insurance described in Section 2.33(b) or (c), or (ii) convert the guaranty provided by such Guarantor to a letter of credit or some other form of financial assurance acceptable to Wildorado I, in each case no later than fifteen (15) days after receiving notice from Wildorado I that such procurement or conversion is required pursuant to this paragraph. At any other time at Wildorado IIs option, Wildorado II may satisfy the requirements of Section 2.33(b) or (c) by (A) above. The insurance policies required by this Section 2.33 shall (i) be primary non-contributory and not excess to or contributing with any other insurance or self-insurance carried by Wildorado I; (ii) waive subrogation against Wildorado I or Wildorado Interconnect and waive any right of the insurers to any setoff or counterclaim or any other deduction, whether by attachment or otherwise, in respect of any liability of Wildorado I or Wildorado Interconnect; and (iii) include a clause requiring the insurer to make final payment on any claim within ninety days after the submission of proof of loss and its acceptance by the insurer. The insurance policies required by this Section 2.33 shall contain a provision that coverages afforded under the policies will not be canceled, allowed to expire, or the limits in any manner reduced, including erosion of aggregates, until at least ninety days prior written notice (ten days in the case of nonpayment of premium) has been given to Wildorado I, and shall also provide that in the event Wildorado II fails to pay the premium, Wildorado I shall have the right (but not the obligation) to pay the premium and continue coverage. If any of the required insurance coverages contain aggregate limits applying to other operations of Wildorado II, and such limits are diminished by any incident, occurrence, claim, settlement, or judgment against such insurance, Wildorado II shall take immediate steps to restore such aggregate limits or shall provide other insurance protection to maintain the required aggregate limits. The insurance policies required by this Section 2.33 shall be placed with insurance carries authorized to do business in Texas and rated with (x) an AM Best Insurance rating of A- or better and a financial size category of X or higher, or (y) a Standard & Poors financial strength rating of A- or higher, or (z) other insurance companies of recognized responsibility satisfactory to Wildorado I. The insurance policies required by Section 2.33(b) and (c) shall name Wildorado I or its designee as Sole Loss Payee with respect to the contractually required insurance under Section 2.33(b) and (c). The policy shall include an acceptable lenders loss payable endorsement such as 438 BFU or other acceptable equivalent wording (or, if there are no Wildorado I Lenders, a multiple insured clause) which shall contain non-vitiation language which shall provide that in the event that Wildorado II performs a vitiating act that might otherwise void coverage, the coverage will remain in full force and effect for the benefit of Wildorado I and the Wildorado I Lenders and shall provide that any payment thereunder with respect to the required cover for any loss or damage with respect to Wildorado I shall be made to Wildorado I or its designee. All costs, premiums, expenses and/or fees associated with the insurance required pursuant to this Section 2.33 shall be for Wildorado IIs account (and shall not be Shared Expenses). Each Party shall, and shall cause each of its applicable affiliates to, use commercially reasonable efforts to assist the other Party in obtaining or renewing applicable insurance coverages and/or making, prosecuting and administrating any claim thereunder. Within thirty (30) days of a request by Wildorado II, Wildorado I shall provide such information as may be required for Wildorado II to obtain the placement or renewal of any insurance coverage referenced in this Section 2.33. Such information shall include a full and complete worksheet prepared by Wildorado I detailing the lost revenues exposure for purposes of determining the coverage amounts required. The format and the detail of the worksheet shall be in a form reasonably acceptable to Wildorado II. The Manager shall have the power and authority to disconnect the Wildorado II Project for failure to comply with the provisions of this Section 2.33 (i) immediately, with respect to a failure to maintain the required insurance, or (ii) if such failure is not cured within thirty (30) days following notice from the Manager, with respect to a delay in providing required certificates. In such event, the Wildorado II Project shall be reconnected when the specific default is cured in full. Letter of Credit for Interconnection Construction Costs. On or before the Effective Date, Wildorado II shall post and maintain a letter of credit issued by an LC Bank for the benefit of Wildorado I, in a form reasonably acceptable to Wildorado I, in an amount equal to the estimated cost of construction of the joint interconnection assets required to be constructed under the Interconnection Agreement, which can be drawn by Wildorado I in the event of a claim by Transmission Owner or Interconnector related to those construction obligations under the Interconnection Agreement. Wildorado II will maintain such letter of credit until the joint interconnection assets required to be built under the Interconnection Agreement have been energized. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the letter of credit described in Section 2.34(a) above shall not be required if Transmission Owner and Interconnector both acknowledge in writing that if the commercial operation date for the Wildorado II Project does not occur by December 31, 2011, none of Wildorado I, Wildorado Interconnect, nor Wildorado II will have any obligation to make the incremental investments necessary to accommodate the Wildorado II Project or construct the joint interconnection assets required to be constructed under the Interconnection Agreement. MANAGEMENT Manager. The Common Facilities shall be managed by a Manager, as described herein. The Manager shall manage the Common Facilities in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. Subject to Section 2.16, the Manager shall be responsible for conducting the daily business affairs related to the Common Facilities and for making the day-to-day operating decisions. The initial Manager is Wildorado I. Intentionally Deleted. Delegation of Authority. The Manager may, from time to time, delegate to one or more individuals such authority and duties as the Manager may deem advisable to carry out the day-to-day business related to the Common Facilities, whether on a Project basis or otherwise. Intentionally Deleted. Budget. General. For each Fiscal Year in which the Sharing Ratio of Wildorado II is greater than zero percent (0%), the Manager shall prepare and submit to each Cotenant a budget and an operating plan for the next Fiscal Year (the Budget) at least sixty (60) days prior to the start of such Fiscal Year. The Budget shall be set out in such format and in such detail as the Cotenants may reasonably require, and shall itemize such budgeted amounts on a monthly basis, including estimates and detailed descriptions. The Budget shall include as a minimum: the Managers bona fide best estimate of Shared Expenses, including without limitation, any Managers out-of-pocket or overhead costs; identification of any material discrepancies against the last preceding Budget; any necessary or proposed repairs and maintenance to be carried out on all parts of the Common Facilities, including all works which are likely to require or cause a curtailment; and such other reasonable information as any Cotenant shall have requested. Approval Procedure. The Parties shall consult and shall use all reasonable endeavors to reach an agreement on each proposed Budget, so as to obtain the approval thereof by the Cotenants and the Manager prior to the commencement of the applicable Fiscal Year to which such proposed Budget relates, provided, that, if agreement is not reached by the start of the applicable Fiscal Year, the Budget for the previous Fiscal Year, increased for inflation, shall be utilized until a new Budget can be agreed to by the Cotenants and the Manager. If a Cotenant or the Manager requires modifications to any of the Budget or proposed amendments submitted to it under this Section 3.5, such party shall notify the other parties in writing of such modifications and its reasons therefor. Each Cotenant and the Manager shall exercise its power to approve or require modifications to the proposed Budget or amendments reasonably and promptly and in any event within thirty (30) days of delivery to such party of the proposed Budget or modification thereto (the Delivery Date). The parties shall consult and use all reasonable endeavors to reach agreement in respect of such modifications required by a Cotenant or the Manager within thirty (30) days following the Delivery Date. Budget Control. Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, including, but not limited to, Section 2.16(c)(iii), the Manager shall use good faith to comply with the Budget for the applicable Fiscal Year and shall have no authority save as approved by the Cotenants and save as provided in this Agreement to undertake any transaction or incur any expenditure which is not part of or which exceeds any budgeted amounts specified in such Budget. Prudent Management. The Manager covenants and agrees to manage, supervise, operate, and maintain the Common Facilities in accordance with this Agreement and with Prudent Wind Industry Practices. Voting or Approval Rights. Each Cotenant shall have the right to vote or give its approval, in proportion to its Sharing Ratio, on any matter requiring or needing the vote or approval of the Cotenants. A Cotenant may not vote any increase in its Common Facilities Percentage Interest unless such increase has been approved by all Cotenants. TRANSFERABILITY General Restriction. No Cotenant shall Transfer any of its rights or interests in the Common Facilities or this Agreement without a corresponding Transfer of its Project Controlled Assets to which such rights or interests in the Common Facilities or this Agreement relate. Each Cotenant shall Transfer its rights and interests in the Common Facilities and this Agreement to any purchaser of such Cotenants Project Controlled Assets or any Person succeeding to substantially all of such Cotenants interests in its Project Controlled Assets. Each Cotenant may collaterally assign its interest in this Agreement and its Undivided Interests (including the right to receive payments under the Interconnection Agreement with respect to such Cotenants Project) to a Power Purchaser or lender provided such Cotenants Project Controlled Assets are collaterally assigned concurrently therewith, but no such assignment shall subordinate or otherwise adversely affect the rights of the other Cotenants in and to this Agreement or the Common Facilities covered hereby. In addition, each Cotenant shall, upon the reasonable request of another Cotenant, provide customary estoppels and consents in favor of a lender or a Power Purchaser, including rights of step-in with respect to a Cotenants obligations under this Agreement and rights to concurrent notice of default. FERC or other Governmental Approvals. Notwithstanding anything in this Article IV to the contrary, no Transfer, other than the initial Transfer of certain rights to Wildorado II, of any Cotenants interests in the Common Facilities or this Agreement shall be effective unless and until the applicable Cotenant has obtained any necessary approvals from FERC as may be required under the Federal Power Act or from any Texas state regulatory agency having jurisdiction over the Common Facilities. Lender Protections. Right to Encumber. The Manager and each Cotenant specifically agree that (i) any Cotenant may at any time pledge, collaterally assign, encumber, or grant a security interest in its own Undivided Interests and in its rights under this Agreement to any lender or other financing entity and (ii) any lender or other financing entity may exercise its rights under its agreement with the pledging Cotenant, including foreclosing, receiving, transferring, conveying or assigning the Undivided Interests, in each case without obtaining the consent of the other Cotenants or the Manager. The Manager and each Cotenant also agree that it shall, at any time and from time to time during the term of this Agreement, after receipt of a written request by another Cotenant, execute and deliver to the other Cotenant and that Cotenants lender or other financing entity, as designated in such request, such estoppel certificates and consents as may be reasonably requested thereby. Pledge, Collateral Assignment or Encumbrance. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, should a Cotenant pledge, collaterally assign or encumber its Undivided Interests and its rights under this Agreement as provided in Section 4.3(a) above, the Cotenants expressly agree between themselves and for the benefit of any lender or other financing entity that (i) no Cotenant shall amend or attempt to amend this Agreement or any other agreement related to the Common Facilities in any material respect unless the consent of such lenders or financing entities is first obtained, (ii) upon the occurrence of a default by a Cotenant hereunder, the non-defaulting Cotenant declaring the default shall also provide written notice to such lenders or financing entities of such default (and accept their cure of such default), (iii) each lender or other financing entity shall have the same period after receipt of a notice of default to cure, or cause to be cured, the default described therein, as is given to the defaulting Cotenant, plus, in each instance, the following additional time periods: (a) thirty (30) days in the event of any monetary default; and (b) sixty (60) days in the event of any non-monetary default; provided, however, that such sixty (60) day period shall be extended for the time reasonably required by the lender or other financing entity to complete such cure, and (iv) in case of the conveyance, transfer, assignment or foreclosure of the pledged Undivided Interests or termination of this Agreement as a result of any default under this Agreement or any agreement with any lender or other financing entity or the bankruptcy, insolvency or appointment of a receiver in bankruptcy for a Cotenant (the Pledging Cotenant), (1) the other Cotenants (the Non-Pledging Cotenants) shall, if applicable, give prompt notice of such conveyance, transfer, assignment, foreclosure or termination to the lenders or financing entities of the Pledging Cotenant and (2) the Non-Pledging Cotenants shall, upon written request of such lender or other financing entity of the Pledging Cotenant, made within forty (40) days after such written notice to such lender or other financing entity, accept such lender or other financing entity, or its designee or assignee, as a cotenant to this Agreement or enter into a new cotenancy agreement with such lender or other financing entity, or its designee or assignee, within twenty (20) days after the receipt of such request. Any such new cotenancy agreement shall be effective as of the date of the termination of this Agreement by reason of default by the Pledging Cotenant, upon the same terms, covenants, conditions and agreements as contained in this Agreement. Upon the acceptance of such lender or other financing entity, or its designee or assignee, as a Cotenant hereunder, or upon execution of any such new cotenancy agreement, the secured parties, or their designees or assignees, of the Pledging Cotenant shall (A) pay the Non-Pledging Cotenants any amounts which are due the Non-Pledging Cotenants from the Pledging Cotenant under the terms of this Agreement, (B) pay the Manager any and all amounts which would have been due from the Pledging Cotenant under this Agreement (had this Agreement not been so conveyed, transferred, assigned or terminated), and (C) agree in writing to perform or cause to be performed all of the other covenants and agreements set forth in this Agreement to be performed by the Pledging Cotenant to the extent that the Pledging Cotenant failed to perform the same. A lender or other financing entity shall only be liable under this Agreement while it is in possession of or is the owner of an Undivided Interest, and only to the extent of its interest in the Pledging Cotenants assets. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES Representations and Warranties of Cotenants and Manager. Each Cotenant represents and warrants for the benefit of the other Cotenants and the Manager, and the Manager represents and warrants for the benefit of the Cotenants: It is a limited liability company, duly organized and existing in good standing under the laws of the state of its formation, qualified to do business in the State of Texas, and has the requisite power and authority to enter into this Agreement. That this Agreement has been duly authorized and constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligation of it, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms, and the execution and delivery of this Agreement and performance of its obligations hereunder will not require the approval of any governmental authority and will not contravene, conflict with or result in the breach or violation of any document to which it is bound or in any law, rule or regulation. It possesses all requisite power and authority to perform this Agreement and to carry out the transactions contemplated herein. No suit, action or arbitration, or legal, administrative or other proceeding is pending or, to its knowledge, threatened against it that would affect the validity or enforceability of this Agreement or the ability of it to fulfill its obligations and commitments hereunder. TERM AND TERMINATION Term and Termination. The term of this Agreement shall commence as of the Effective Date and shall terminate upon the first to occur of: (i) a single Cotenant becoming the owner of the entire ownership interest in all of the Common Facilities, or (ii) the mutual agreement of all the Cotenants, with the consent of the then existing secured parties that hold a lien or security interest in a Cotenants Undivided Interests or in the Common Facilities. For FERC filing purposes, this Agreement shall become effective on the later to occur of (a) the Effective Date or (b) the effective date designated by FERC when this Agreement is accepted for filing by FERC. Surrender and Assignment of Undivided Interest. Any Cotenant may elect, but only with the consent of the Cotenant or Cotenants accepting the Undivided Interest, to convey its Undivided Interest and assign its rights hereunder to another Cotenant or Cotenants and, thereupon, to cease to have any right, title or interest in the Common Facilities or its Undivided Interest; provided that: (A) the surrendering Cotenant executes and delivers all instruments of transfer as may be necessary or appropriate to effect (and that do effect) the conveyance of its Undivided Interest and assignment of its rights hereunder to, and which are reasonably satisfactory to, the remaining Cotenant or Cotenants, (B) such assignment and conveyance is accompanied by an assignment by the surrendering Cotenant to the remaining Cotenant or Cotenants of all its rights under this Agreement and (C) an encumbered Undivided Interest may only be surrendered with the written consent of each secured party that holds a security interest in such Undivided Interest and a release of such secured partys security interest therein. The surrendering Cotenant shall remain fully responsible for, and shall pay its full share of, all Shared Expenses through the effective date of the surrender of its Undivided Interest. No surrender of a Cotenants Undivided Interest shall relieve the surrendering Cotenant of any of its obligations under any agreement, unless expressly provided for in this Agreement, or in a writing among the Cotenants. Abandonment or Decommissioning of a Project. In addition to the obligations of the surrendering Cotenant set forth in Section 6.2 (unless the assignee Cotenants expressly assume such obligations) and in the event a Cotenant desires to decommission and abandon its Project, and the Undivided Interests of such Cotenant are not accepted by any of the other Cotenants, the surrendering Cotenant shall, upon notice to the other Cotenants of its intent to abandon its Project, be responsible for its proportionate share (as determined by such Cotenants Sharing Ratio as of the date notice of intent to abandon and decommission its Project is given to the other Cotenants) of the costs and expenses (the Demolition Expenses) of the removal of the Common Facilities and the restoration of the shared premises as required by the Shared Real Property Documents, (collectively, the Withdrawal Costs). The Manager shall administer the calculation, collection, and distribution of the Withdrawal Costs, as follows: The Manager shall calculate the Withdrawal Costs and shall provide written notice of same to the surrendering Cotenant within forty-five (45) days after the Manager has received notice of Cotenants intent to abandon its Project. The surrendering Cotenant shall, within thirty (30) days of the receipt of the written notice of the Withdrawal Costs, pay the Withdrawal Costs to the Manager. The Withdrawal Costs shall be maintained by the Manager in a reserve account and used by the Manager for removal of the Common Facilities and the restoration of the shared premises when same becomes necessary. Any dispute in regard to the amount of the Withdrawal Costs shall be submitted to dispute resolution pursuant to the terms of Section 2.26. Any failure to pay the Withdrawal Costs shall constitute a default hereunder and the applicable Cotenant shall forfeit all of its Undivided Interests hereunder to the other Cotenants and shall immediately cease and desist from the use of the Common Facilities. The surrendering Cotenant further irrevocably appoints the Manager as its true and lawful attorney, with full power of substitution, for the sole use and benefit of the remaining Cotenants, but at the surrendering Cotenants expense, to the extent permitted by law to exercise, at any time and from time to time while the surrendering Cotenants default has occurred and is continuing, the power to sell, transfer, assign or otherwise deal in or with the Undivided Interests of the surrendering Cotenant or the proceeds thereof, as fully and effectually as if the Manager were the absolute owner thereof, provided that the Manager shall give to the surrendering Cotenant not less than ten (10) days prior written notice of the time and place of a sale or other intended transfer or disposition of any of the Undivided Interests. Any Undivided Interest of the surrendering Cotenant transferred or surrendered to the other Cotenants shall be allocated to each remaining Cotenant on a pro rata basis in accordance with each remaining Cotenants Sharing Ratio. Distribution on Termination of this Agreement. In the event that the Cotenants decide to decommission all of the Projects and to proceed with the removal of the Common Facilities, the Manager shall take account of all the Cotenants joint assets covered by this Agreement, including the Common Facilities, and joint liabilities pursuant to this Agreement and shall proceed with the liquidation thereof. The assets covered by this Agreement shall be liquidated under the supervision of the Manager as promptly as is consistent with obtaining a reasonable value therefor, and the proceeds therefrom, together with any assets distributed in-kind, shall be applied and distributed as follows: To the payment of debts and liabilities of the Cotenants to third parties in connection with the Common Facilities which are then due and the expenses of liquidation. To the setting up of any reserves which the Manager deems reasonably necessary for any contingent or unforeseen liabilities or obligations or debts not yet payable by the Cotenants in connection with the Common Facilities, including any reserves to pay costs associated with the decommissioning and removal of the Common Facilities. Any sum remaining shall be distributed on a pro rata basis based upon each Cotenants Sharing Ratio as of the date of final termination of this Agreement. The Manager shall have the right, in order to effectuate the liquidation of the assets covered by this Agreement to disconnect the Common Facilities from the Interconnector Substation and the Projects. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS Notices. Any notice, demand, or communication required or permitted to be given by any provision of this Agreement shall be deemed to have been sufficiently given or served for all purposes if delivered personally or by telecopy to the Party or to an executive officer of the Party to whom the same is directed or, if sent by registered or certified mail, postage and charges prepaid, addressed to the Managers and/or Cotenants address, as appropriate. The Managers and Cotenants addresses are: For Wildorado I: Wildorado Wind, LLC c/o Edison Mission Energy 18101 Von Karman Ave., Suite 1700 Irvine, CA 92612 Attention: General Counsel Facsimile: (949) 798-7411 For Wildorado II: Wildorado Wind Two, LLC c/c Cielo Wind Services, Inc. 823 Congress Avenue, Suite 500 Austin, TX 78701 Attention: Walter Hornaday, President Facsimile: (512) 440-0277 For Manager: Wildorado Wind, LLC, Manager c/o Edison Mission Energy 18101 Von Karman Ave., Suite 1700 Irvine, CA 92612 Attention: General Counsel Facsimile: (949) 798-7411 Choice of Law. This Agreement shall in all respects be governed by and construed and enforced in accordance with the internal laws of the State of Texas without regard to its choice of law provisions. With respect to action to enforce any arbitration award, the Cotenants hereby irrevocably submit to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of any state or federal court in the State of Texas with respect to any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to any such dispute. All disputes under this Agreement will be resolved by the state or federal courts of the State of Texas. Each Cotenant hereto irrevocably and unconditionally waives trial by jury in any action, suit or proceeding relating to a dispute and for any counterclaim with respect thereto. To the extent that any Party has or hereafter may acquire any immunity from jurisdiction of any of the above-named courts or from any legal process therein, with respect to itself or its property, such Party hereby irrevocably waives, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, such immunity, and each Party hereby irrevocably waives, to the extent permitted by applicable Law, and agrees not to assert, by way of motion, as a defense, or otherwise, in any legal action or proceeding brought hereunder in any of the above-named courts, (i) that it or any of its property is immune from the above described legal process or (ii) that such action or proceeding is brought in an inconvenient forum, that venue for the action or proceeding is improper or that this Agreement or any other transaction or document related to this Agreement may not be enforced in or by such courts. Covenants Running with the Land. The covenants of the Cotenants made in this Agreement shall be deemed to be covenants running with and binding upon the land pursuant to applicable Law for the duration of the term of this Agreement. The Common Facilities and each Cotenants Undivided Interest shall be held, conveyed, hypothecated, encumbered, transferred and used subject to the covenants, terms and provisions set forth in this Agreement, which shall run with the Common Facilities, each Cotenants Undivided Interest and each portion thereof and interest therein as equitable servitudes, and shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Cotenants and any other Person having any interest therein during their ownership thereof, and their respective grantees, assignees, transferees, heirs, legatees, executors, administrators, successors and assigns, and all persons claiming under them. Time is of the essence with respect to this Agreement. No Partnership; Tenant-in-Common Status. The relationship of the Cotenants under this Agreement is that of tenants-in-common. Nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to constitute any Cotenant a partner of, or joint venturer with, any other Cotenant. The employees, agents, and subcontractors of the Cotenants, in performing the obligations of each respective Cotenant under this Agreement, shall not be deemed to be the agents or employees or subcontractors of any other Cotenant. Each Cotenant acknowledges that while the Cotenants hold undivided interests in the Common Facilities, each Cotenants right to occupy and use the Common Facilities is governed by and subject to this Agreement (and in the case of the Interconnection Agreement, the operating agreement for Wildorado Interconnect). Entity Cotenant. If any Cotenant is an entity and distributes its Undivided Interest to its members, shareholders, partners or owners, voluntarily, in the course of dissolution or by operation of law, then such distributees shall become Cotenants under this Agreement in the place of such Cotenant, owning pro rata in accordance with their former interest therein the Undivided Interest of such Cotenant, and each such distributee shall keep, perform, and be bound by all the terms, covenants, and conditions of this Agreement. Representative Capacity. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, during any period that any Undivided Interest is subject to administration in an estate, guardianship or conservatorship, such interest shall be ignored in determining the consents or agreements required for the taking of any action by the Manager or the other Cotenant, it being intended that the difficulty in obtaining consents or agreements from any person acting in such representative capacity shall not interfere with or impede the Cotenants activities or operations on or with respect to the Common Facilities. Titles. The titles to the Sections of this Agreement are for convenience only, are not a part of this Agreement, and shall have no effect upon the construction or interpretation of any provision of this Agreement. Survival of Agreement. In the event that this Agreement is terminated with respect to any Cotenant for any reason (including, without limitation, as a result of a rejection of this Agreement by a trustee or debtor-in-possession in any bankruptcy or insolvency proceeding with respect to such Cotenant), then (i) this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect and (ii) all provisions of this Agreement shall be automatically modified to reflect the fact that the terminated Cotenant is no longer a party to this Agreement. Entire Agreement. This Agreement sets forth the complete understanding of the Parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior discussions, agreements, and undertakings relating to the subject matter hereof. Interpretation. In the event of any inconsistencies between the provisions of this Agreement and any other agreement entered into by the Parties with respect to the Wildorado I Project, the Wildorado II Project and/or the Bushorado Project, as between the Parties and solely in respect of the Common Facilities, the provisions of this Agreement shall control. All personal pronouns used in this Agreement, whether used in the masculine, feminine or neuter gender, shall include all other genders; the singular shall include the plural; and the plural shall include the singular. Titles of articles and Sections in this Agreement are for convenience only and neither limit nor amplify the provisions of this Agreement. All references in this Agreement to articles, Sections, subsections or paragraphs shall refer to articles, Sections, subsections and paragraphs of this Agreement, unless specific reference is made to the articles, Sections or other subdivisions of another document or instrument. The word including shall mean including without limitation. This Agreement shall not be interpreted in favor of any Party by virtue of said Party not having prepared this Agreement. The unenforceability, invalidity, or illegality of any provision of this Agreement shall not affect or impair the continuing enforceability or validity of any other part, all of which shall survive and be valid and enforceable. Waiver. No consent or waiver, express or implied by any Party hereto, to or of any breach or default by the other in the performance by the other of its obligations hereunder shall be deemed or construed to be a consent or waiver to or of any other breach or default in the performance by such other Party of the same or any other obligations of such Party hereunder. Failure on the part of any Party hereto to complain of any act or failure to act of any other Party, or to declare such other Party in default, irrespective of how long such failure continues, shall not constitute a waiver of such Party of its rights hereunder. No Third Party Beneficiaries. This Agreement and the terms and provisions hereof are solely and exclusively for the benefit of the Parties hereto. No third party may rely on any of the provisions herein contained or lay claim to any of the rights of the Parties hereto. Counterparts; Facsimile Signatures. This Agreement may be executed in counterparts each of which when so executed and delivered shall be deemed to be an original and all of which together shall constitute one instrument. Facsimile signatures shall be binding upon the Parties hereto with the same force and effect as original signatures. Amendments. Except as specifically provided in this Agreement, this Agreement may not be amended except by the written agreement of all the Cotenants. Further Assurances. Upon the reasonable request of any Cotenant, the other Cotenants shall forthwith execute and deliver such further instruments of assignment, transfer, conveyance, endorsement, direction or authorization and other documents as the requesting Cotenant or its or their counsel may reasonably request in order to effectuate the purposes of this Agreement. Each Cotenant agrees to cooperate fully with the other Cotenants in assisting them to comply with the terms of this Agreement, including, but not limited to, assistance in obtaining consents, waivers, authorizations, waivers, authorizations, orders and/or approvals of third parties. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no Cotenant shall be required to make any substantial payment or incur any material economic burden, except for a payment otherwise required of it, pursuant to this Section 7.15. Each Cotenant agrees to execute any customary consent and assignment in favor of a Power Purchaser, Interconnector or a lender requested by any other Cotenant. Memorandum. Concurrently with execution hereof, the Cotenants shall execute and deliver a Memorandum of this Agreement, which Memorandum shall promptly be recorded in the official records of Oldham, Potter and Randall Counties, Texas. Side Letters. Each Cotenant shall (i) use commercially reasonable efforts to cause each Side Letter to be duly executed and delivered by each party thereto and, (ii) upon the due execution and delivery of each Side Letter, perform its obligations, as applicable, under such Side Letter. ASSIGNMENT AND ASSUMPTION AGREEMENT (Assigned Assets) THIS ASSIGNMENT AND ASSUMPTION AGREEMENT (this Agreement) is made as of September 30, 2010 (the Effective Date) by and between WILDORADO WIND, LLC, a Texas limited liability company (f/k/a Wildorado Wind, LP) (in its capacity as assignor, Assignor) and WILDORADO WIND, LLC, a Texas limited liability company and WILDORADO WIND TWO, LLC, a Texas limited liability company, as tenants-in-common (collectively, in their capacities as assignees, Assignee). Assignee and Assignor are referred to herein collectively as the Parties and each individually as a Party. Recitals: A. WHEREAS, Assignor owns those certain poles, grounds, neutrals, communication equipment, metering devices and related facilities, together with the associated communications and engineering data, specifications and permits, each as more specifically described on Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein (the Assigned Assets), which interconnect with the facilities owned, controlled and operated by Southwestern Public Service Company (d/b/a Xcel Energy) (Xcel) and Southwest Power Pool, Inc. (SPP). B. WHEREAS, Assignor desires to sell, assign, transfer and convey to Assignee, and Assignee desires to purchase and assume all of Assignors rights, title, interests and obligations in and to the Assigned Assets, subject to Assignors Retained Rights (as defined below). C. WHEREAS, on the terms and conditions set forth herein, Assignor and Assignee have agreed that Assignor will sell, assign, transfer and convey to Assignee all of Assignors rights, title, interests and obligations in and to the Assigned Assets, subject to Assignors Retained Rights (as defined below). Agreement: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the promises contained herein, the parties hereto, intending to be legally bound hereby, agree as follows: Assignment and Assumption. For agreed consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, Assignor hereby irrevocably sells, assigns, transfers and conveys to Assignee, and Assignee hereby irrevocably purchases and assumes from Assignor, subject to and in accordance with this Agreement (including, but not limited to, Assignors Retained Rights), all of Assignors rights, title, interests and obligations in and to the Assigned Assets. Such sale, assignment, transfer and conveyance is without recourse to Assignor and, except as expressly provided in this Agreement, without representation or warranty by Assignor. Notwithstanding the forgoing, Assignor excepts, reserves and retains a license to enter onto and/or use the Assigned Assets to: (i) inspect any and all facilities, including, but not limited to, any transmission or other utility lines (collectively, the Facilities), (ii) promptly implement, supervise, monitor, organize and undertake activities necessary to deal with emergency situations affecting the Facilities involving risks to person or property or interfering with the normal operation of the Facilities (but with no obligation to undertake any such actions), (iii) perform or install necessary or beneficial repairs and/or upgrades to the Facilities necessary for the beneficial use and operation of Assignors existing wind energy facility commonly known as the Wildorado I Project which Assignee has failed to implement or undertake following the five (5) business days prior written notice from Assignor, and (iv) cure any breaches or defaults existing with respect to the Assigned Assets (collectively, the Retained Rights). Tenants-in-Common Status. Each of Wildorado Wind, LLC, in its capacity as an assignee hereunder, and Wildorado Wind Two, LLC shall have an equal undivided legal interest, as tenants-in-common, in the rights assigned by Assignor pursuant to this Agreement. Representations and Warranties of Assignor. Assignor hereby represents and warrants to Assignee as follows: (i) it is a limited liability company duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the State of Texas, (ii) it has full power and authority, and has taken all action necessary, to execute and deliver this Agreement and to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby and (iii) this Agreement constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of Assignor enforceable against it in accordance with its terms, except as may be limited by bankruptcy, reorganization, receivership, insolvency or other similar laws affecting the enforcement of creditors rights generally. Representations and Warranties of Assignee. Assignee hereby represents and warrants to Assignor as follows: (i) each assignee is a limited liability company duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the State of Texas; (ii) each assignee has full power and authority, and has taken all action necessary, to execute and deliver this Agreement and to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby; (iii) from and after the Effective Date, each assignee shall be bound by the provisions of, or obligations related to, each Assigned Asset; and (iv) this Agreement constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of each assignee enforceable against each assignee in accordance with its terms, except as may be limited by bankruptcy, reorganization, receivership, insolvency or other similar laws affecting the enforcement of creditors rights generally. Survival of Representations, Warranties and Covenants. The representations and warranties of the Parties contained herein shall survive the consummation of the transactions contemplated herein. Further Assurances. Each Party hereby agrees, from and after the Effective Date, upon the request of the other Party, to execute such other documents as the other Party may reasonably require in order to obtain the full benefit of this Agreement and such Partys obligations hereunder or which may be necessary to effectuate the transfer of the Assigned Assets. Successors and Assigns. This instrument is executed by and shall be binding upon the Parties, their successors and permitted assigns. General Provisions. This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, which together shall constitute one instrument. Delivery of an executed counterpart of a signature page of this Agreement by telecopy shall be effective as delivery of a manually executed counterpart of this Agreement. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of Texas, without giving effect to the conflict of laws principles thereof. Consent of TXDOT. Assignor, Assignee and the Texas Department of Transportation (TXDOT) have entered into that certain Consent Agreement dated as of 8-31-2010, attached hereto as Exhibit B pursuant to which TXDOT has consented to the assignment hereunder of the Interstate 40 Crossing Approval. I-40 Permit No. 0090-05-735 1801 VON KARMAN AVE. Maintenance Section No. 002 IRVINE, CA 92612 County POTTER Date 08/28/2006 The Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT) offers no objection to the location on the right-of-way of your proposed OVERHEAD ELECTRIC POWER line as shown by accompanying drawings and notice dated 8/14/2006 except as noted below. Your attention is directed to governing laws, especially to Article 6674w-1, Vernons Annotated Civil Statues of Texas, pertaining to Control of Access. Access for servicing this installation shall be limited to access via (a) frontage roads where provided (b) nearby or adjacent public roads or streets, or (c) trails along or near the highway right-of-way lines, connecting only to an intersecting road; from any one or all of which entry may be made to the outer portion of the highway right-of-way for normal service and maintenance operations. The Utility Owners rights of access to the through-traffic roadways and ramps shall be subject to the same rules and regulations as apply to the general public except, however, if an emergency situation occurs and usual means of access for normal service operations will not permit the immediate action required by the Utility Owner in making emergency repairs as required for the safety and welfare of the public, the Utility Owner shall have a temporary right of access to and from the through-traffic roadways and ramps as necessary to accomplish the required emergency repairs, provided TxDOT is immediately notified by the Utility Owner when such repairs are initiated and adequate provision is made by the Utility Owner for the convenience and safety of highway traffic. It is expressly understood that TxDOT does not purport, hereby, to grant any right, claim, title, or easement in or upon this highway; and it is further understood that TxDOT may require the Utility Owner to relocate this line, subject to provisions of governing laws, by giving thirty (30) days written notice. All work on the highway right-of-way shall be performed in accordance with TxDOT instructions. The installation shall not damage any part of the highway and adequate provisions must be made to cause minimum inconveniences to traffic and adjacent property owners. In the event the Utility Owner fails to comply with any or all of the requirements as set forth herein, the state may take such action as it deems appropriate to compel compliance. General Special Provisions: SEE ATTACHED SPECIAL PROVISIONS: *UNLESS CONSTRUCTED, PERMIT WILL EXPIRE 6 MONTHS AFTER THE ABOVE APPROVAL DATE. Revegetation Special Provisions: In order to minimize erosion and sedimentation resulting from the proposed installation, the project area will be revegetated in accordance with TxDOTs Standard Specification Item 164 which specifies the appropriate grass seed mix to be used. Please Notify Dwayne Gidden 378-0072 forty-eight (48) hours prior to starting construction of the line in order that we may have a representative present. Texas Department of Transportation By: /s/ For District Engineer Amarillo District
